title: How to Tie a Tie on Someone Else

steps.title: Position the tie around the other person's shoulders.
steps.content: Position the tie around the other person's shoulders. From your perspective facing the other person, the wide end of the tie should hang on your left, and the narrow end on your right. Adjust the tie until the tip of the wide end is roughly 12 inches (30 cm) below the narrow end. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cross the wide end over the narrow.
steps.content: Cross the wide end over the narrow. The wide end should now be on your right (over the wearer's left side).

steps.title: Bring the wide end back under.
steps.content: Bring the wide end back under. Cross the wide end under the narrow end and back over to your left.

steps.title: Cross over one more time.
steps.content: Cross over one more time. Bring the wide end back over the narrow end as before.

steps.title: Pull up through the neck loop.
steps.content: Pull up through the neck loop. Fold the wide tip under itself and pull it up through the loop at the wearer's collar.

steps.title: Bring it down through the front loop.
steps.content: Bring it down through the front loop. The wearer should now have a horizontal loop at the front of his tie. Insert the wide end through this loop and pull through.

steps.title: Create the dimple.
steps.content: Create the dimple. A dimple is fairly easy to create with the four-in-hand knot, and improves the appearance of the tie. Here's how to make one: Pinch the sides of the tie just below the front knot. The sides should curl upward and a dimple should appear in the center. Pull the wide end to tighten the tie. Give the knot a final pinch to help the dimple stay in place.

steps.title: Start with the seam side upward.
steps.content: Start with the seam side upward. Drape the tie around the other person's collar, so the underside of the tie faces you. Let the wide end fall on the left side (from your perspective), and the narrow end on your right. The wide end should reach about 1–2 inches (2.5–5 cm) below the wearer's belt buckle, or about 12 inches (30 cm) below the tip of the narrow end. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Cross the wide end beneath the narrow end.
steps.content: Cross the wide end beneath the narrow end. Bring the wide end of the tie over to your right side (the left side of the wearer's body).

steps.title: Bring the wide end up and through the neck loop.
steps.content: Bring the wide end up and through the neck loop. Raise the wide end up to the loop at the wearer's collar. Insert the tip from above and pull through completely. Keep the wide end on the same side, without crossing the narrow end.

steps.title: Cross the wide end over the narrow end.
steps.content: Cross the wide end over the narrow end. The wide end should now be back in front of your left hand, with the seamless front side facing you.

steps.title: Insert the wide end into your neck loop from below.
steps.content: Insert the wide end into your neck loop from below. Fold the tip under itself and pull through the neck loop.

steps.title: Pull through the front loop.
steps.content: Pull through the front loop. Loosen the horizontal loop at the front of the tie with your finger. Bring the wide end through this loop and pull through. The wide end should end roughly at the top of the wearer's belt buckle, and completely cover the narrow end underneath.

steps.title: Tighten the tie.
steps.content: Tighten the tie. Pull down on the wide end and slide the knot upward to complete the look.

steps.title: Position the tie.
steps.content: Position the tie. Face the other person and drape the tie around his or her neck, so the front side of the fabric faces you. Keep the wide end on your left (the wearer's right), and about 12 inches (30 cm) below the tip of the narrow end on your right. The wearer may need a spread or wide spread collar to accommodate this knot, especially if you use a tie with thick fabric.

steps.title: Loop the wide end over and under the narrow end.
steps.content: Loop the wide end over and under the narrow end. Cross the wide end over the narrow end, then cross back under. The wide end should now be back on your left, with the seam side face up.

steps.title: Pull the wide end through the neck loop from above.
steps.content: Pull the wide end through the neck loop from above. Pull down through the loop at a diagonal, crossing underneath the narrow end.

steps.title: Fold the wide end across the narrow.
steps.content: Fold the wide end across the narrow. The wide end should now be back on your left again.

steps.title: Insert into the neck loop from below.
steps.content: Insert into the neck loop from below. Bring the wide end up through the center of the neck loop.

steps.title: Finish in the front loop.
steps.content: Finish in the front loop. Loosen the horizontal front knot and insert the wide end through it. Pull down to tighten and slide the front knot up near your collar.

steps.title: Position the wide end low on your left side.
steps.content: Position the wide end low on your left side. Stand in front of the person who will wear the tie. Drape the tie over the wearer's neck so the wide end is on your left (the wearer's right). Adjust the tie so the wide end is 14 inches (36 cm) lower than the narrow end. [3] X Research source This very formal knot is also one of the largest in common use. Make sure the wearer pairs it with a spread or wide spread collar, and that the tie is long enough to accommodate the greater number of folds.

steps.title: Bring the wide end over the narrow end.
steps.content: Bring the wide end over the narrow end. Cross the wide end over the wearer's chest so it is on your right.

steps.title: Loop the wide end through the neck loop from below.
steps.content: Loop the wide end through the neck loop from below. Fold the wide end up through the neck loop from below. Loop it around and pull down over the front of the neck loop. Keep it on your right as you do this.

steps.title: Fold the wide end under the narrow.
steps.content: Fold the wide end under the narrow. Cross the wide end back to your left.

steps.title: Loop around the neck loop from above.
steps.content: Loop around the neck loop from above. Bring the wide tip up to the front of the neck loop, and insert from above. Pull through so the wide end is back on your left, with the seam side facing you.

steps.title: Cross the ends one last time.
steps.content: Cross the ends one last time. Fold the wide end over the narrow end, so the front side is once again visible.

steps.title: Insert through the neck loop from below.
steps.content: Insert through the neck loop from below. Bring the wide end back up to the neck loop. Insert from below and pull through.

steps.title: Fasten the ends with the front loop.
steps.content: Fasten the ends with the front loop. Tuck the wide end back down into the front loop near the top of the tie. Pinch the lower corners of the front knot and slide upward as you gently pull on the wide end.
